channel.title: [TUT] VBScript
channel.description:
[center][size=15pt][b]MORE TO COME[/b][/size][/center] [b]Display Date, Time, & Month:[/b] [code] [/code] Well this basically does everything by itself. But you need to change the Monthname # to the # of the month. E.G. "document.write(MonthName(1))" This would be January because January is the "1" Month. [b]Create a Variable:[/b] [code] [/code] All you have to do is change the "Moparisthebest.com ROCKSSS.. -Cabby" To whatever you would like it to say xD! [b]Uppercase & Lowercase:[/b] [code] [/code] the "ucase" stands for Uppercase and the "lcase" Stands for lowercase.. So where it says "Moparis..." Change that to what you would like it to say, and it will display the txt in both ucase and lcase :) [b]Date Checker:[/b] -Pointless? [code] [/code] This will tell you whether the date is real(true) or if it is fake(false). Just replace the "somedate" with your own date :) Quite pointless don't ya think?, well unless your using it to do as a birthdate for a signup form. [b]Create An Array:[/b] [code] [/code] Just change the "Name(#)="..."" to whatever you like.. So you don't have to worry about it, i would leave the "for i=0 to 99" how it is. But if go over 99 you have to change it.. [b]Text format using HTML tags:[/b] [code]
[/code] Well pretty self explanatory, just change the HTML tags to a different one.. A COUPLE HTML TAGS:: [code]

[/code]

item.title: [TUT] VBScript
item.dc:creator: @Cabby Cabby
item.description:
@Cabby wrote:

[center][size=15pt]MORE TO COME[/size][/center]

Display Date, Time, & Month:

[code]

[/code] Well this basically does everything by itself. But you need to change the Monthname # to the # of the month. E.G. "document.write(MonthName(1))" This would be January because January is the "1" Month.

Create a Variable:

<html>
<body>

<script type="text/vbscript">
dim name
name="Moparisthebest.com ROCKSSS.. -Cabby"
document.write(name)
</script>

</body>
</html>

All you have to do is change the “Moparisthebest.com ROCKSSS… -Cabby” To whatever you would like it to say xD!

Uppercase & Lowercase:

<html>
<body>

<script type="text/vbscript">
txt="Moparisthebest.com Tutorial"
document.write(ucase(txt))
document.write("<br />")
document.write(lcase(txt))
</script>

</body>
</html>

the “ucase” stands for Uppercase and the “lcase” Stands for lowercase…
So where it says “Moparis…” Change that to what you would like it to say, and it will display the txt in both ucase and lcase

Date Checker: -Pointless?

<html>
<body>

<script type="text/vbscript">
somedate="1/1/07"
document.write(IsDate(somedate))
</script>

</body>
</html>

This will tell you whether the date is real(true) or if it is fake(false).
Just replace the “somedate” with your own date
Quite pointless don’t ya think?, well unless your using it to do as a birthdate for a signup form.

Create An Array:

<html>
<body>

<script type="text/vbscript">
dim name(6)
name(0)="Moparisthebest.com"
name(1)="cabby"
name(2)="tutorial"
for i=0 to 99
  document.write(name(i) & "<br />")
next
</script>

</body>
</html>

Just change the “Name(#)=”…"" to whatever you like…
So you don’t have to worry about it, i would leave the “for i=0 to 99” how it is. But if go over 99 you have to change it…

Text format using HTML tags:

<html>
<body>

<script type="text/vbscript">
document.write("<b>Cabby</b>")
</script>
<br>
<script type="text/vbscript">
document.write("<i>Cabby</i>")
</script>

</body>
</html>

Well pretty self explanatory, just change the HTML tags to a different one…
A COUPLE HTML TAGS::

<b>
<i>
<u>
<s>
<h2>
<h3>
<p>

Read full topic
